page.title: 18TRAFFIC SURVEY RESULTS
page.content: THE RESULTS OF THE SURVEY SHOWED THAT: 1.THERE WERE 140 COMMERCIAL VEHICLES USING DORCHESTER ROAD EVERY HOUR. 2.THERE WERE 44 PUBLIC TRANSPORT VEHICLES EVERY HOUR. 3.THERE WERE 700 PRIVATE VEHICLES EVERY HOUR. 4.IN ALL CASES LOCAL VEHICLES WERE OUTNUMBERED BY VEHICLES REGISTERED OUT SIDE THE LOCAL AREA - IT WAS ASSUMED THAT THE MAJORITY OF THESE WERE CARRYING HOLIDAYMAKERS. THE ORIGINAL NOTION THAT THE DORCHESTER ROAD WAS THE BUSIEST ROADWAY IN THE AREA IS BORNE OUT BY THESE RESULTS. AS THE WHOLE REGION IS A VERY POPULAR TOURIST AREA IT IS NOT SURPRISING THAT VISITORS TRANSPORT SHOULD OUTNUMBER THAT OF THE LOCALS IN THE SUMMER SEASON.
